alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 02 at 3:44PM AKST until March 03 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds ahead of a strengthening low pressure system will turn to the west as the low crosses from the North Pacific into the Bering Sea Thursday afternoon. The strongest gusts are expected out of the west near Unalaska and Akutan Thursday afternoon before quickly diminishing late Thursday evening.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
